page.title: 16A DAIRY FARM
page.content: {Whingill}is a dairy farm near{Hartley} and it is tenanted by Mr.C.Jenkinson. He has 180 acres plus another 100 acres on a yearly rent. He has a herd of 42 Fresian cows and 50 young stock. For the last 15 years he has been selling his milk to Mr.D. Jackson who delivers doorstep milk in the{Kirkby {Stepen}area. These last 3 years the milk has been bottled on the farm to comply with ministry regulations. Mr Jackson buys about 150 gallons daily and any surplus is sold to the Express Dairy in{Appleby.} The cows are fed on dairy cake, beet pulp and silage. the milk is tested twice a month for brucellosis, tuberculosis, cleanliness and keeping qualities and the buildings and equipment are checked 3 times a year by the Ministry of Agriculture.
